description: Denver: Colorado Public Utilities Commission has issued the following document:. TRI-STATE GENERATION AND TRANSMISSION ASSOCIATION, INC. TO DELTAMONTROSE. As directed by the Colorado Public Utilities Commission in Interim.
sourceClass: Government Agencies (U.S.), Government Policy, Local Government, National Government

subjectCode.description: Trading Impact (ICE Codes) Important Corporate Events

text:
Denver: Colorado Public Utilities Commission has issued the following document
(filing):

BEFORE THE PUBLIC UTILITIES COMMISSION OF THE STATE OF COLORADO

PROCEEDING NO. 20A-0164E

IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF DELTA-MONTROSE ELECTRIC

ASSOCIATION AND TRI-STATE GENERATION AND TRANSMISSION ASSOCIATION,

INC. FOR AN ORDER APPROVING THE TRANSFER OF CERTAIN TRANSMISSION

ASSETS AND CERTIFICATES OF PUBLIC CONVENIENCE AND NECESSITY FROM

TRI-STATE GENERATION AND TRANSMISSION ASSOCIATION, INC. TO DELTAMONTROSE

ELECTRIC ASSOCIATION.

JOINT APPLICANTS' VERIFIED RESPONSE TO

INTERIM DECISION REQUIRING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

As directed by the Colorado Public Utilities Commission ("Commission") in
Interim

Decision No. C20-0411-I (the "Decision"), Delta-Montrose Electric Association
("DMEA") and

Tri-State Generation and Transmission Association, Inc. ("Tri-State")
(together the "Joint

Applicants") submit this filing to supplement information in their Verified
Joint Application and

Request for Expedited Treatment (the "Application").

The Joint Applicants respectfully request that the Commission, upon review of
the

Application as supplemented by this filing, approve the Application and the
transfer of

transmission assets and certificates of public convenience and necessity
(together the "Assets")

from Tri-State to DMEA. In further support of their Application, Joint
Applicants state as

follows:

I. Joint Applicants' supplemental information in this filing underscores that

the Application is not contrary to the public interest and merits approval.

1\. As part of its review of the Application, the Commission has directed the
Joint

Applicants to file supplemental information about three areas:

Colorado PUC E-Filings System

2

a. The Joint Applicants' request for expedited consideration of the
Application;1

b. Tri-State's filings at the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission ("FERC")

relating to DMEA's withdrawal from Tri-State, including the relationship

between those FERC filings and this Application before the Commission;2 and

c. Additional information regarding certain certificates of public convenience

and necessity ("CPCN") associated with this Application that were transferred

from Colorado-Ute Electric Association, Inc. ("Colorado-Ute") to Tri-State.3

2\. Through this filing, the Joint Applicants supplement their Application so
that the

Commission may more effectively review the transfer request.4 As detailed
below, the

information in the original Application and this supplement establish that
transfer of the Assets

to DMEA merits expedited review and that such transfer is not contrary to the
public interest.

II. Expedited consideration of the Application will allow transfer of the
Assets

by DMEA's anticipated withdrawal date of June 30, 2020, thereby promoting

the public interest and avoiding expense and operational complications.

3\. DMEA initiated its withdrawal from Tri-State in November 2016. Following

proceedings before this Commission5 and in state district court,6 Tri-State
and DMEA reached a

July 19, 2019 Settlement Agreement7 providing for DMEA's withdrawal from Tri-
State.

4\. DMEA's withdrawal is scheduled to occur at 11:59:59 pm on June 30, 2020,
with

certain related transactions--including purchase of the Assets--occurring at
the same time.8

1 Decision at P 10.

2 Id. at P 11. In this filing, the "Commission" refers to the Colorado Public
Utilities Commission; the filing

refers to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission only as "FERC."

3 Id. at PP 12-14.

4 Id. at PP 1.

5 Delta-Montrose Elec. Ass'n v. Tri-State Generation & Transmission Ass'n,
Inc., Proceeding No. 18F-

0866E (filed Dec. 6, 2018).

6 Tri-State Generation & Transmission Ass'n, Inc. v. Delta-Montrose Elec.
Ass'n, 2019 CV 30066 (Adams

County); Delta-Montrose Elec. Ass'n v. Tri-State Generation & Transmission
Ass'n, Inc. 2019 CV 31054 (Adams

County).

Tri-State Generation and Transmission Association, Inc.

TRI-STATE GENERATION AND TRANSMISSION ASSOCIATION, INC.

title: Regulatory update: Colorado Public Utilities Commission;TRI-STATE GENERATION AND TRANSMISSION ASSOCIATION, INC. , has issued ( 20A-0164E) Joint Applicants' Verified Response to Interim Decision Requiring Additional Information.
html:
Denver: Colorado Public Utilities Commission has issued the following document (filing):

BEFORE THE PUBLIC UTILITIES COMMISSION OF THE STATE OF COLORADO

PROCEEDING NO. 20A-0164E

IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF DELTA-MONTROSE ELECTRIC

ASSOCIATION AND TRI-STATE GENERATION AND TRANSMISSION ASSOCIATION,

INC. FOR AN ORDER APPROVING THE TRANSFER OF CERTAIN TRANSMISSION

ASSETS AND CERTIFICATES OF PUBLIC CONVENIENCE AND NECESSITY FROM

TRI-STATE GENERATION AND TRANSMISSION ASSOCIATION, INC. TO DELTAMONTROSE

ELECTRIC ASSOCIATION.

JOINT APPLICANTS' VERIFIED RESPONSE TO

INTERIM DECISION REQUIRING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

As directed by the Colorado Public Utilities Commission ("Commission") in Interim

Decision No. C20-0411-I (the "Decision"), Delta-Montrose Electric Association ("DMEA") and

Tri-State Generation and Transmission Association, Inc. ("Tri-State") (together the "Joint

Applicants") submit this filing to supplement information in their Verified Joint Application and

Request for Expedited Treatment (the "Application").

The Joint Applicants respectfully request that the Commission, upon review of the

Application as supplemented by this filing, approve the Application and the transfer of

transmission assets and certificates of public convenience and necessity (together the "Assets")

from Tri-State to DMEA. In further support of their Application, Joint Applicants state as

follows:

I. Joint Applicants' supplemental information in this filing underscores that

the Application is not contrary to the public interest and merits approval.

1. As part of its review of the Application, the Commission has directed the Joint

Applicants to file supplemental information about three areas:

Colorado PUC E-Filings System

2

a. The Joint Applicants' request for expedited consideration of the Application;1

b. Tri-State's filings at the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission ("FERC")

relating to DMEA's withdrawal from Tri-State, including the relationship

between those FERC filings and this Application before the Commission;2 and

c. Additional information regarding certain certificates of public convenience

and necessity ("CPCN") associated with this Application that were transferred

from Colorado-Ute Electric Association, Inc. ("Colorado-Ute") to Tri-State.3

2. Through this filing, the Joint Applicants supplement their Application so that the

Commission may more effectively review the transfer request.4 As detailed below, the

information in the original Application and this supplement establish that transfer of the Assets

to DMEA merits expedited review and that such transfer is not contrary to the public interest.

II. Expedited consideration of the Application will allow transfer of the Assets

by DMEA's anticipated withdrawal date of June 30, 2020, thereby promoting

the public interest and avoiding expense and operational complications.

3. DMEA initiated its withdrawal from Tri-State in November 2016. Following

proceedings before this Commission5 and in state district court,6 Tri-State and DMEA reached a

July 19, 2019 Settlement Agreement7 providing for DMEA's withdrawal from Tri-State.

4. DMEA's withdrawal is scheduled to occur at 11:59:59 pm on June 30, 2020, with

certain related transactions--including purchase of the Assets--occurring at the same time.8

1 Decision at P 10.

2 Id. at P 11. In this filing, the "Commission" refers to the Colorado Public Utilities Commission; the filing

refers to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission only as "FERC."

3 Id. at PP 12-14.

4 Id. at PP 1.

5 Delta-Montrose Elec. Ass'n v. Tri-State Generation & Transmission Ass'n, Inc., Proceeding No. 18F-

0866E (filed Dec. 6, 2018).

6 Tri-State Generation & Transmission Ass'n, Inc. v. Delta-Montrose Elec. Ass'n, 2019 CV 30066 (Adams

County); Delta-Montrose Elec. Ass'n v. Tri-State Generation & Transmission Ass'n, Inc. 2019 CV 31054 (Adams

County).
